refnamediv.refpurpose: Retrieves serviceList message matching search criteria

refsect1.title: Attributes & Children
refsect1.para: The name, categoryBag, and tModelBag arguments are mutually exclusive.

refsect2.title: maxRows
refsect2.para: This optional integer value allows the requesting program to limit the number of results returned.

refsect2.title: businessKey
refsect2.para: This uuid_key is used to specify a particular BusinessEntity instance.

refsect2.title: findQualifiers
refsect2.para: This collection of findQualifier elements can be used to alter the default behavior of search functionality.

refsect2.title: name
refsect2.para: This string value represents a partial name. Any businessService data contained in the specified businessEntity with a matching partial name value gets returned.

refsect2.title: categoryBag
refsect2.para: This is a list of category references. The returned serviceList contains businessInfo structures matching all of the categories passed (logical AND).

refsect2.title: tModelBag
refsect2.para: This is a list of tModel uuid_key values that represent the technical fingerprint the server should locate within a bindingTemplate structure contained within any businessService contained by the businessEntity specified. If more than one tModel key is specified in this structure, only businessServices that contain bindingTemplate information that matches all of the tModel keys specified will be returned (logical AND).

refsect1.title: Return Types
refsect1.para: This function returns a serviceList on success. In the event that no matches were located for the specified criteria, the serviceList structure returned will contain an empty businessServices structure. This signifies zero matches.

In the event of a large number of matches, a UDDI-enabled server may truncate the result set. If this occurs, the serviceList will contain the truncated attribute with the value of this attribute set to true.

Searching using tModelBag will return serviceInfo structures for all qualifying businessService data, including matches due to hostingRedirector references. In other words, if the businessEntity whose businessKey is passed as an argument contains a bindingTemplate with a hostingRedirector value, and that value references a bindingTemplate that matches the tModel search requirements, then the serviceInfo for the businessService containing the hostingRedirector will be returned.

row.entry: signifies that the uuid_key value passed did not match with any known businessKey or tModel key values. The error structure will signal which condition occurred first.
signifies that the partial name value passed exceeds the maximum name length designated by the server.
signifies that more than one mutually exclusive argument was passed.
signifies that one of the findQualifier values passed was invalid.
